Samedan can be reached by train

. It takes around 15 minutes to reach Samedan from Pontresina or St. Moritz. The train ride to Chur lasts around 2 hours. Consider the convenience of buying a day rail pass which can be used for both train and bus.

It takes around 1.5 hours to drive from Chur to Samedan. From Poschiavo, you reach Samedan over the Bernina pass and departing from Chiavenna you have to drive over the Maloja pass. There are three spectacular mountain passes by which you can reach Samedan when coming from
. In winter it’s advisable to take a car train
to get into the Engadin, because the mountain passes are usually very icy.
There are a lot of taxis in and around Samedan. But travelling by taxi is rather pricey in Switzerland.
A cheaper possibility is travelling around by bus. The bus drives from
and stops in every village. In the high season buses run every 10 minutes.
In and around Samedan you will find a lot of parking areas.
You can take a sightseeing tour by helicopter
. You can even determine the course of the flight yourself. A flight of 20 minutes costs CHF 190 and a flight of 30 minutes is around CHF 270.

The magic of Samedan are the silence and the beauty of the mountains. It is a perfect place to relax and forget about the tedious stress. True shopping is hardly possible there. However, there are a number of cosy bakeries in which you can enjoy homemade pastries.
Samedan is only 15 minutes away from St. Moritz, a true shopping paradise with small romantic high-end boutiques.
